programme.title: Air Bud: World Pup
programme.desc: Pup Star is back and bigger than ever as the hit singing-pup competition show goes global! After achieving international stardom, Tiny the adorable Yorkie joins the celebrity judges for the first-ever Pup Star World Tour. The judges each welcome their favourite contestant from around the world to the Pup Star pack, training them to compete for the new title of global pup star champion. India's Raji joins Team Growl, China's Ming joins Team Paw-Paw, Nigeria's Mobo joins Team Gnarley, and Mexico's dashing telenovela star Julio joins Team Tiny.

programme.title: Swiped
programme.desc: A womanising college student (Noah Centineo) enlists his nerdy roommate (Kendall Sanders) to code the ultimate hook up app by offering to pay his tuition for MIT but unexpected consequences ensue.

programme.title: Walk of Shame
programme.desc: After losing an audition for her dream job, Meghan Miles, a Los Angeles TV news anchor, goes out for an uncharacteristic night of partying. She awakes in a stranger’s bed to a phone message announcing the job is hers, if she can make it to the news station by time of broadcast. Stranded in an unknown area without money, a phone, and a car, Meghan — clad in a provocative yellow dress — embarks on a series of misadventures. As she races to the most important job interview of her life, she finds herself among drug dealers and hookers — all while being pursued by the LAPD, an angry taxi driver, and a young kid with an attitude.

programme.title: Couples Vacation
programme.desc: With his marriage and career against the ropes, dejected author Jack Spencer travels with his wife, Amanda, to an isolated glamping retreat in search of a spark. When a surprise double booking finds their private retreat anything but private, Jack spins into a comedic exploration of love, lost dreams, small-town-wisdom, and friendship with a miniature donkey to get over himself before he loses all he holds dear.

programme.title: Humor Me
programme.desc: Desolate, broke and unable to pay the rent, Nate begrudgingly moves in with his widowed father, Bob (Elliott Gould), in his New Jersey retirement golf community. Bob, always quick with a joke, uses humor to deal with all of life's challenges, even the death of his beloved wife. It drives Nate crazy. Thinking his son could benefit from some discipline, Bob sends Nate to work for Ellis (Willie Carpenter) an older ex-Marine who runs operations at the community. While at work, Nate stumbles on a senior citizen theater troupe staging a musical. Nate agrees to help but quickly realises it won't be easy to get these quirky women to cooperate.

programme.title: The Truth About
programme.desc: Today we are going to meet the coaches. These men and women have one goal in mind: to lead an athlete or an entire team to victory. And if you think that standing on the side-lines barking orders is a job for the timid, think again. Because to win a cup or a trophy, you have to be able to keep calm when you are under pressure. But that's not all. A good coach can turn their experience as a player into coaching skills or even succeed without any experience in a big team. Finally, whatever their fate, they support their team whether in victory or in defeat. Some are very much in the public eye, others are unobtrusive, but none of them can hide the truth.

This film follows the women’s incredible journey as they find a way to pass their stories to their children.

programme.title: Only Me Generation
programme.desc: Has China’s ‘one child policy’ really created a generation of spoilt, privileged, selfish young adults? This documentary is a brave expose of what everyday life is like for the ‘Only Me’ generation in China. For the first time on camera, these young Chinese will speak candidly of the huge pressure and high expectations from their parents and reveal the dreams, worries, hopes and fears of a generation.

programme.title: Traceable

But will positioning her collection in the sustainable domain enable her to survive in the highly competitive fashion industry?

programme.title: Nuremberg - The Nazis Facing Their Crimes
programme.desc: It was one of the biggest trials of the 20th century. The one that opened the way for the creation of an international justice system. It was the first trial to be filmed, and yet very few people have ever seen the nearly 25 hours of original footage. For the very 1st time, a film takes viewers inside the courtroom, via the original trial footage filmed by John Ford's crew.

programme.title: To The Moon - From Dream To Reality
programme.desc: Between 1969 and 1972 twelve men walked on the surface of the moon. It was seen as the first chapter in an ambitious program of space exploration. But what started with NASA’s Apollo missions ended with the Apollo missions. Humanity’s boldest venture is now 50 years in the past. Although the Apollo missions were relatively short, it can not be underestimated just how groundbreaking its achievements were.

programme.title: Shifting Ice + Changing Tides
programme.desc: ‘Shifting Ice and Changing Tides’ is a human and wind powered, female led, ski and sail expedition to the west coast of Greenland. programme.title: Aina
programme.desc: ‘ĀINA: That Which Feeds Us’ – The best-kept secret on Kaua`i isn’t a secluded beach or local surf spot, it’s that four of the world’s largest chemical companies are using the island as an open-air testing ground for pesticides on genetically modified crops. Winner Accolades Global Film Competition.

programme.title: Break Point: a Davis Cup Story
programme.desc: Led by Rafa Nadal, the Spanish team were this year’s favourite until they suffered a serious setback. The team’s number two player, Roberto Bautista, had to leave the competition for his hometown to be at his father´s side during the last hours of his life. Without Bautista, Nadal and Feliciano López heroically managed to lead the team into the final. But then came the news that thrilled tennis fans worldwide: Bautista is coming back to the competition after his father´s funeral, and he´s ready to play. United again, the members of the Spanish team fight for victory in the grand final, where something far beyond tennis is at stake.

programme.title: MessiCirque
programme.desc: We will see the formative moments, the creative and artistic development, Messi´s participation with the project, training, rehearsals and the "Messi10 Challenge LaLiga". This is the interactive experience that lets you "be Messi for a day", ending with the long-awaited premiere of Messi10 in Barcelona. We will accompany the creators, artists and Messi on a trip from Montreal to Barcelona and discover a story about dreams that come true. MessiCirque combines Cirque du Soleil´s vision to tell, for the first time, the story of a living sports legend with a child´s ambition to play football.

programme.title: Inside Kilian Jornet
programme.desc: For Kilian Jornet, the world's greatest mountain athlete, the arrival of his thirties coincided with the best and worst year of his life. This documentary follows Jornet through an intense 10-day tour of 10 cities around the world, allowing the public to see, for the first time, everything that goes on around the professional athlete, and revealing his lesser-known, uninhibited side. Between presentations, interviews, and brand commitments, and with only a few hours' sleep, the athlete reflects on a year marked by injuries his search for the balance between competition and personal projects and the arrival of his first daughter.

programme.title: Eighteam
programme.desc: The Chipolopolo is the Zambia national team that at the 1988 Olympic thrashes Italy 4-0 and has their eyes on the Africa Cup of Nations. But in 1993 a Zambian Air Force ditches into the ocean about 500 metres offshore from Gabon. All passengers, including 18 players, die in the accident.The Chipolopolo's captain, Kalusha Bwalya, who is not aboard the ill-fated flight puts his efforts to build a new team and make a professional federation becoming later the national team coach and president of the Football Association of Zambia. Two decades later, destiny makes Zambia a blink: in Gabon, Zambia becomes African champions for the first time after a long penalty shoot-out. There are 18 penalties.

programme.title: The Giants - New in Town (Episode 1)
programme.desc: Konishiki arrives in Japan during the height of the Japanese economic boom. He doesn’t have a dollar or yen to his name and has no understanding of the Japanese culture or language. Fortunately, he’s brought to Japan by Takamiyama who provides him with the mentorship needed for a foreigner in sumo wrestling. Just two years into his sumo career, his star is on the rise as he faces the greatest sumo wrestlers of the time.

programme.title: The Giants - Foreign Yokozuna (Episode 2)
programme.desc: Konishiki has become the most dominant sumo wrestler of the time. In fear of his stardom, the institutions step in the way to deter his path to Yokozuna. However, a new crop of Hawaiian sumo wrestlers have arrived following the path provided by Takamiyama and Konishiki. As Konishiki is impeded, we meet Akebono and Musashimaru who show there is nothing that is going to stop the Hawaiian sumo giants.

programme.title: The Giants - The Gods (Episode 3)
programme.desc: Despite the effort to limit foreign influence in Japan’s national sport, there is no denying the excitement around the Hawaiian sumo stars. Japanese and global sumo fans begin embracing the Hawaiian sumo wrestlers and encourage them to become “diplomats” for the Japanese culture. Their influence on the global stage becomes clear and their legacy is set. Sumo will never be the same.

programme.title: Ride Your Dream
programme.desc: Motorcycling was a man’s world, until now. This documentary introduces us to Ana Carrasco, the Spanish rider who has revolutionised the two wheels’ world and who, from an early age, had a clear dream: being world champion. Through intimate conversations with her family and team, we get to know Ana’s motivations, the obstacles she has faced and the dreams she keeps chasing. Her career, from its origins in a small town in Murcia to being the first woman to win the World Championship, is a source of inspiration for anyone. Ana herself is a clear example of overcoming struggle and tenacity, and her story which is full of exciting moments encourages us all to fight for our dreams.

programme.title: Killer in the Caves
programme.desc: About 6.5 million bats have died in the last six years in North America. A disease is driving the Little Brown Bats to extinction and causes mass mortalities among other bat species. The epidemic is still a riddle, but bat-experts piece together information like criminal investigators. The ingenuity of the scientists is captured through astonishing experiments and groundbreaking technology in an effort to understand this mysterious disease and learn more about this common yet unknown animal.

programme.title: The Okinaway of Life

The archipelago of Okinawa, located in the Pacific Ocean at the very south of Japan sees its population with almost no diseases. What are the secrets of Okinawa’s inhabitants ? How can we live longer, happy and in good health ?

programme.title: Eavesdrop

programme.title: Leading Lady
programme.desc: Jodi, an idealistic British drama teacher, travels to a South African town to prepare for a major film role. In rehearsals Jodi's interactions with quirky locals may teach her that there is more to life than lights... camera... and action!

programme.title: Three Chen Sisters: Three Chen Sisters
programme.desc: Jennifer, the older sister struggles with singleness Amanda, the middle sister, deals with her lack of excitement in life and the youngest daughter tries to come to terms with her Chinese identity. Watch these three Chinese American women deal with their cultural identity and navigate their complicated lives through dating, career, school, and family in Southern California.

programme.title: Al Murray - One Man, One Guvnor
programme.desc: The Pub Landlord is back to save the nation, in this, his latest stand-up extravaganza, because he knows what the country really needs right now is some bloke waving a pint around offering common sense solutions. Join the Guv as he sets out the manifesto for his Guv'norment, sorts out the world's financial system and fixes the NHS, all while pulling the perfectly poured pint. So charge your glasses (remember, pint for the fella, glass of white wine or fruit based drink for the lady) and join The Pub Landlord in celebrating 20 years at the lager top in this brand new stand up show.

programme.title: Soundtrack to Sixteen
programme.desc: Soundtrack to Sixteen is a coming-of-age film about two anxious teens growing up in London in the 2000s. Maisy is self-conscious and constantly overanalysing. She is obsessed with having her first kiss this year, before she turns seventeen, but stalking the boy next door doesn't seem to be working. Meanwhile Ben, a boy from a nearby school, is happy being a nerd and thinking he's better than everyone else until his grades start plummeting. For the first time he must come face to face with the idea that he might, in fact, be average. When the two meet each other on the night bus things get even more confusing for them as they attempt to navigate their first potential romance under the stress of exams that will define their future.

programme.title: Laura McKenzie's Traveler
programme.desc: Dublin- O'Donoghue's pub, the Ha' Penny Bridge, Powers Court Center, Oscar Wilde's old home. Laura stops at the National Museum of Ireland, the Temple Bar, and the banks of the River Liffey.

programme.title: Elizabeth Stanton's Great Big World
programme.desc: Olympic Games -Elizabeth and friends have some Olympic Games fun with long track speed skating, bobsled, National Ability Center, and Snow Tubing.

programme.title: Jack Rio
programme.desc: A famous actor in Los Angeles tries to escape his on-screen persona, the T.V. character that has made him famous, and find himself again, while a string of murders seem to follow in his wake. Is it the work of an obsessed fan? Or something far worse?

programme.title: Lords of the Mafia
programme.desc: Japanese Yakuza- Organized crime syndicates from Japan are now a major menace all over the Pacific Rim. Also known as the "boryokudan," which means "the violent ones," they are feared for their ruthlessness and strict codes of violence. Their "Little Caesar" is the flamboyant Yoshinori Watanabe, who was inducted in 1989 as "kumicho" (boss of bosses), presiding over the 105 "oyabun" (bosses) of Japan's 750 Yakuza gangs. With 22,000 soldiers, Watanabe's outfit — the Yamaguchi-gumi — is easily the largest and most powerful.

programme.title: Real Vice Cops
programme.desc: In Orlando ns Memphis, , the vice squads bust several narcotics operations and conduct prostitution stings where human trafficking takes place.

programme.title: World War Four
programme.desc: A series of escalating incidents around the world lead to greater and greater conflict, placing the superpowers at one another's throats. Armies march, bombs rain down, soldiers storm the beaches. One family is caught up in the ever-growing conflict. Can they survive as total war is declared and nuclear weapons are unleashed

programme.title: Laura McKenzie's Traveler
programme.desc: Dublin- O'Donoghue's pub, the Ha' Penny Bridge, Powers Court Center, Oscar Wilde's old home. Laura stops at the National Museum of Ireland, the Temple Bar, and the banks of the River Liffey.

programme.title: B-Sides
programme.desc: B-Sides covers Austin City Limits 2021 featuring interviews with performers Tate McRae, PAYDAY, and Jany Green.

programme.title: Lords of the Mafia
programme.desc: Colombian/Latin American Cartels- Cali cartel boss Gilberto Rodriguez Orejuela nicknamed the "Chess Player," and Pablo Escobar. Orejuela has expanded manufacturing and smuggling operations and has continued the Colombian tradition of bribing or killing government officials. Said to bring in more than $4 billion a year from drug sales, he has invested hundreds of millions in banks in Russia, Europe, and the United States.

programme.title: Asia Unplated with Diana Chan
programme.desc:
Asia Unplated follows Diana Chan as she explores the fresh, aromatic flavours of Asia. Each episode focuses on a different cuisine, showcasing a variety of traditional and modern dishes from each country.
Along the way, we join Diana as she explores the local shops, restaurants and markets, providing tips and advice for sourcing ingredients for each dish.
Then it’s back to her kitchen where Diana cooks up simple but authentic, home-style Asian dishes. She also invites special guests, friends and passionate foodies into the kitchen to show us their favourite recipes and chat about the unique cooking styles and rich food histories of their favorite Asian cuisines.

programme.title: James Bond: For Our Eyes Only
programme.desc: In 1953, James Bond first emerged as a character in Ian Fleming's novel ‘Casino Royale’, and just nine years later the spy was the protagonist in the film ‘Dr. No’ – thus starting one of the longest and most successful franchises in the history of cinema. Beautiful women, exhilarating stunts, breath-taking locales and the charm of a handsome English secret agent have formed the essential ingredients of all Bond films. Recount and relive all of 007’s menacing missions, from the first feature film production in 1962 to the highly anticipated ‘No Time To Die’.

programme.title: Aliens: Are We Alone?
programme.desc: Does alien life exist out there in the Universe? Scientists are now getting closer than ever to answering that question thanks to the Kepler Space Telescope. This revolutionary spacecraft is on a mission to find habitable alien planets. Thanks to Kepler, we now know of thousands of possible planets and we’re getting closer than ever to finding the holy grail: a twin of our Earth. We use CGI to bring these alien worlds to life, and with the help of scientists, we speculate on what extra-terrestrial life might be like.

programme.title: Jack Pierce: The Maker Of Monsters
programme.desc: In today's cinematic world of digital effects, telling what is real from what was created in a computer is impossible. But there was a time when Hollywood relied on nothing more than an artist's ability to create a boogie man with grease paint, cotton, glue, hair, and a few simple materials to draw people into the theatre to be chilled and thrilled.

programme.title: Waking The Titanic
programme.desc: Waking the Titanic is something special, a living history told on a small, but no less poignant human scale. Through stylised re-enactments, the docudrama recreates the story of the Addergoole 14 and what happened to them on the Titanic. The story is told using detailed accounts handed down to family members from the people of the time and interviews with the descendents of 3 who survived.

programme.title: Switzerland: Hitler's Bankers
programme.desc: A series of unprecedented revelations explains how Germany was able to finance its huge war expenses. The war might have ended in 1943 had Switzerland not recycled the gold looted by the Nazis throughout Europe and France.

programme.title: It Takes a Thief
programme.desc: Single females, Marlene and Katrina see the madness in their security methods as they protect their unlocked home in a wholly unorthodox manner. Resident thief John shows them how their own security ideas can work precariously against them!

programme.title: ICEolation
programme.desc: Antarctica is a place few get to visit, let alone connect with. This is the story of two paddlers with adventurous spirits, whom when presented with an unique opportunity to undertake a self-supported sea kayak expedition in Antarctica, took it. Took it as an opportunity to go beyond adrenalin-based desires and the pleasing of engorged ego’s and instead explore as much within themselves as explore the magical, ice-littered waterways of the Antarctic Peninsula. Throughout the narrative, the theme of the film – connection – is woven in, along with an insight into the preparations necessary for an expedition of this magnitude. Together with candid images of the complexities of daily life in this unique environment, this story aims to inspire other adventurous folk to do more than explore just the physical realm of whatever incredible wilderness they next find themselves in. For there really is so much more to explore. Finalist - VIMFF 2020. Winner - World Tour Paddling Film Festival 2020. Best NZ Made Film - New Zealand Mountain Film 2019. Finalist - Audience Awards 2019. Official Selection 2020: Nature Track Film Festival. Official Selections 2019: Adventure Outdoor Fest, Adventure Shorts Film Festival, Cradle Mountain Film Festival, Kendal Mountain Film Festival, Polar Film Festival, AMA.

programme.title: Ancient Splendors of Rome
programme.desc: Two major events occurred in the same period 2,000 years ago. The Colosseum, the largest human-made structure on the earth, was completed (AD 80), and Pompeii disappeared from history in one day due to the explosion of Vesuvius Volcano (AD79), the largest disaster on earth that mankind suffered. These two events serve as precious windows to understand the whole political culture and economic society of Rome, the Millennium Empire, beyond time and space.

programme.title: Cry of the Wild
programme.desc: This feature-length documentary from Bill Mason imparts his affection for the big northern timber wolves and the pure-white Arctic wolves. Filmed over three years in the Northwest Territories, British Columbia, the High Arctic and his home near the Gatineau Hills in Quebec, Mason sets out to dispel the myth of the bloodthirsty wolf. Going beyond the wolf's natural habitat, Mason relocated three young wolves to his own property and was able to film tribal customs, mating and birth. As a result, Cry of the Wild offers viewers access to moments in wildlife never before seen on film.

programme.title: Living The Change: Inspiring Stories For a Sustainable Future
programme.desc: Sometimes it can feel like the environmental, economic and social issues the world is currently facing are too big, too overwhelming, to be dealt with by individuals. Climate change, resource limits, economic downturn, social disconnection. Surely these issues can only be properly managed by our governments? Living the Change explores solutions to the global crises we face today - solutions any one of us can be part of - through the inspiring stories of people pioneering change in their own lives and in their communities in order to live in a sustainable and regenerative way. Directors Jordan Osmond and Antoinette Wilson have brought together stories from their travels around New Zealand, along with interviews with experts able to explain how we come to be where we are today. From forest gardens to composting toilets, community supported agriculture to timebanking, Living the Change offers ways we can rethink our approach to how we live. Each and every one of us has the power to ...

programme.title: 5 to 7
programme.desc: An aspiring novelist enters into a relationship with a woman, though there's just one catch: She's married, and the couple can only meet between the hours of 5 and 7 each evening.

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: Oscar nominated drama starring Johnny Depp and Leonardo DiCaprio. Gilbert feels trapped - with no father present and an eccentric family to care for, he is struggling to cope. His extremely overweight mother cannot leave the house and his younger brother with learning difficulties has a knack for finding trouble. Despite the hardships Gilbert perseveres, but will he be able to live his own life?

programme.title: Voice from the Stone
programme.desc: A haunting horror thriller set in an isolated castle in 1950s Tuscany, Voice From the Stone tells the story of Verena (Emilia Clarke: TV’s Game of Thrones, Me Before You), a determined young nurse who is hired to aid a boy through the trauma of his mother's sudden death. As she works with the troubled boy, she falls under the spell of a malevolent force inside the castle.

programme.title: All I See is You
programme.desc: The film follows the story of a blind woman (portrayed by Blake Lively) and her husband (Jason Clarke). When her sight unexpectedly returns, she begins to discover the previously unseen and disturbing details about themselves, their marriage and their lives.

programme.title: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: An ordinary day in young Agnes' (Jennifer Lawrence The Hunger Games) life is anything but. With a strung-out mother (Selma Blair - Hellboy), a pimp father (Bokeem Woodbine Total Recall) and a home overrun by gamblers, thieves and johns, Agnes is simply trying to survive with her two younger sisters (Sophia Bairley and Chloe Grace Moretz - Carrie). Inspired by true events this poignant, gritty film portrays lives that rise above dismal circumstances, and marks a powerful beginning for first time Writer and Director Lori Petty.

programme.title: Barely Lethal
programme.desc: Megan Walsh is a teenage special ops agent who yearns for a normal adolescence. After faking her own death she assumes the role of an exchange student and quickly learns that surviving the treacherous waters of a typical American high school can be even more difficult than international espionage. Jam-packed with action from the cafeteria to the battleground, and with hilarious performances from Samuel L. Jackson, Jessica Alba and Sophie Turner, Barely Lethal is the unmissable action comedy that shows just how hard surviving high school really is!

programme.title: After the Fall (2014)
programme.desc: When Bill, a family man and hardworking insurance adjuster, is fired from his job, he falls into quiet despair. He still leaves the house every morning pretending to go to work while secretly on a frantic hunt for a new job. Almost by accident, Bill begins a life of crime. Frightened and unsure of himself to begin with, he soon becomes more skilled in his new line of work, targeting those he believes deserve it most. However a close friend, who is a cop, begins to suspect that there may be more to Bill than first appears.

programme.title: 16 Blocks
programme.desc: They chose the worst man for the job. They expected him to fail, but he wasn't about to let a witness be murdered on his watch. Personal demons put Jack (Bruce Willis - Die Hard, Anti-Life) a New York City cop at rock bottom. But when he's assigned to escort a petty criminal to testify before the grand jury, a violent turn of events means this down-and-out cop needs to pull it together to save not only the life of the witness but his own as they are hunted across the city. The clock is ticking in this exhilarating race against time. Will justice be served or will there be two more bodies to add to the crime toll of the city?

programme.title: Invasion Planet Earth
programme.desc: After the death of his young daughter, Tom Dunn is a broken man. When his wife falls pregnant again, he cannot believe their luck. However, his joy is short-lived, as, on the very same day, the people of Earth become plagued with terrifying visions of the end of the world. When a gigantic, all-consuming alien mothership appears in the sky and launches a ruthless attack on Earth's cities, chaos and destruction follow. Tom must find the strength and wisdom to save his wife and unborn child. However, first he must confront a shocking truth. A truth which threatens the key to the survival of the human race. The ultimate war for Planet Earth is about to begin...

programme.title: Witchville
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, Erik and Jason seek out his compatriot Malachy and force him to return to his homeland. When they arrive, they find that Malachy's father, the King, is dead and their lands are completely devastated. Both seek revenge against the Evil Red Queen.

programme.title: Moonwalkers
programme.desc: What if Apollo 11 never actually made it? What if, in reality, Stanley Kubrick secretly shot the famous images of the moon landing in a studio, working for the US administration? This is the premise of a totally plausible conspiracy theory that takes us to swinging sixties London, where a stubborn CIA agent will never find Kubrick but instead is forced to team up with a lousy manager of a seedy rock band to develop the biggest con of all time, in this riotous, high-tempo action-comedy.
